speaker: Lucas
lines: Yeah. Yeah.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Magnus here. In your experiments with these crystals, did you ever hear a voice or sounds like something was talking to you?

speaker: Lucas
lines: Ummm, no. I don’t—  I don’t know what you’re talking about.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Well, okay. All right. I don’t believe you, but—

speaker: Taako
lines: It didn’t happen to us, either. Noooo.

speaker: Merle
lines: Uh-uh.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Nope. Nope.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay. Have you made it to the— to the exit of the conservatory, to the first arcane airlock?

speaker: Magnus
lines: Is it the glowing hatch?

speaker: Lucas
lines: Yeah, that’s what it would look like. Yeah, sure.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Then yes.

speaker: Taako
lines: Hell yeah.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Okay, yeah. Just put your hand on the panel, and I’ll— I’ll channel enough energy into it and let you guys through, and then once you move through that chamber, I’ll be able to shut down that airlock and buy us a little bit more energy and a little bit more time.

speaker: Travis
lines: I do that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: ‘Kay, um—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Wait, is this gonna affect how the reclaimers— all their shit and being able to get in and stuff?

speaker: Merle
lines: I thought we were the only reclaimers.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Are you saying that into the pendant?

speaker: Travis
lines: No, I’ve got my hand over the pendant.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Travis
lines: Talking to Merle and what’s-his-face.

speaker: Taako
lines: I forgot who they are and what they’re doing.

speaker: Merle
lines: I don’t care about them anyway.

speaker: Magnus
lines: The regulators, the ones who are, like, supposed to back us up and, like, arrest—

speaker: Merle
lines: Yeah, they’re doing a great job so far, aren’t they?

speaker: Taako
lines: Where are they?

speaker: Magnus
lines: They got blown away in the gnarly storm.

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh man, like The Martian. Love that book. Listen, okay? We’re done here.

speaker: Griffin
lines: [laughs] That’s a good conversation, guys.

speaker: Taako
lines: I think that we’ve already proven that we can’t keep really good track of them, just from, like, a narrative— human being— like, I don’t think we can keep tabs on ‘em. They’ve got— really gotta fend for themselves, ‘cause we need the time.

speaker: Magnus
lines: You know what? I can’t fault your logic.

speaker: Travis
lines: All right, I uncover the pendant. I put my hand on the thing.

speaker: Taako
lines: Here’s what I’m saying. Either they die—

speaker: Travis
lines: Okay, I re-cover the pendant.

speaker: Taako
lines: Either they die, or we forget them. Either way, they’re not going to—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Probably both.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, probably both.

speaker: Lucas
lines: [muffled] Hey, guys, did you go through the door yet?

speaker: Travis
lines: I uncover the pendant.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Oh, thank god. It was getting a little stuffy in— wait, that doesn’t make sense.

speaker: Magnus
lines: No, that’s not how that works. [someone laughs] Are you in the pendant?

speaker: Taako
lines: Do you live in the pendant?

speaker: Merle
lines: He is independent.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Oh, that’s a good joke. Anyway, just put your hand on the panel on the door and it should open up for you, and— and, um, you’ll— you’ll— you’ll be protected, um, from the, uh, from that crystal thing. You should be— the next chamber should be clear as far as I know.

speaker: Travis
lines: Cool, I do that.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hold on, Merle— Magnus—

speaker: Clint
lines: No, that’s okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: God— son of a dammit. Could you two not have gotten together on the letters with which your names begin?

speaker: Clint
lines: Should I be Perle?

speaker: Travis
lines: Mine actually has a silent P.

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, shit, then you’re Perle and Pagnus. You guys really are the worst two people. [Clint cackles] Um—

speaker: Travis
lines: What were you gonna say, Taako?

speaker: Justin
lines: Dad was gonna say something. I’m just calling him Dad.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay.

speaker: Justin
lines: He’s my dad.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Dad, what were you gonna say?

speaker: Justin
lines: He was gonna say something.

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, I’m in character, so I don’t answer.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Holy shit.

speaker: Justin
lines: Fuck me running. Okay, Merlgnus is gonna say something now.

speaker: Merle
lines: I just was wondering if it might be a trap, but—

speaker: Lucas
lines: Nope.

speaker: Merle
lines: We’re obviously in a hurry to get through the airlock.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Nope, not a trap.

speaker: Merle
lines: Eat me, we don’t know you!

speaker: Taako
lines: You’re a real– you’re a dingbat, too. I don’t like you at all, but let’s go. I say we get through. This is getting boring, and this is a podcast. Let’s go.

speaker: Griffin
lines: You move into the airlock, and it’s like, uh, it’s like an airlock in a spaceship or a submarine. It’s a small chamb—

speaker: Travis
lines: Which we have all been in.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Um, no. Well, maybe? Probably—

speaker: Clint
lines: Maybe in the backstory.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Probably not. It’s just a little chamber, and it has two of these white circular hatches on either side, and as you move into the airlock, it is not crystallized. It is— it’s made of just sort of a white metal, and, um, uh, the hatch closes behind you, and you hear a hissing sound. There’s some, uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: Snakes!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Some smoke in the room, and then the chamber’s full of snakes, and you drown in snakes. You drown in snakes.

speaker: Travis
lines: Not again.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, no, there’s no snakes. Just a little bit of smoke, and then the smoke clears and you hear, like, a bing-bong noise. Maybe I’ll put that in in post, maybe I won’t. Um, and—

speaker: Clint
lines: Wait, wait, wait, you said smoke, and bong. Cheech and Chong are in there.

speaker: Justin
lines: Hell yeah.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I thought you were doing—

speaker: Justin
lines: And they’re covered in snakes!

speaker: Justin
lines: And Cheech is a snake, and so is Chong. They’re both snakes.

speaker: Travis
lines: It’s all snakes. It’s snakes all the way down.

speaker: Justin
lines: Soup to nuts, snakes, snakes, snakes.

speaker: Clint
lines: Man, I hope when J.J. Abrams remakes this podcast, he takes all this stuff out.

speaker: Justin (imitating Abrams yet sounding like a Muppet)
lines: “What we decided to do, guys, is just lose a lot of the snake stuff. We know the fans love it, but we’re worried that it wouldn’t be as approachable material ‘cause, uh, it’s real heavily laden with snakes. I didn’t really underst— it becomes hard to follow because—”

speaker: Travis
lines: Is J.J. Abrams a puppet?

speaker: Justin (still imitating Abrams)
lines: “Our heroes become snakes, and, uh, they are all married to snakes, and they use snakes as weapons.”

speaker: Clint
lines: Hand me some of that macaroni and cheese with snakes on it.

speaker: Travis
lines: Snakes in their blood that lets them do magic.

speaker: Justin
lines: “They eat snakes for fuel, and they become snake robots for a while. It’s very confusing, got rid of most of the snakes. There’s still a lot of snakes, but, I mean, there’s just a regular amount of snakes for The Adventure Zone, which, for any other thing, is still an enormous amount of snakes.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, uh…

speaker: Justin
lines: “And lens flare! [more laughter] That’s the two big things.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: So, uh, on the other end of this airlock, is more snakes. Uh—

speaker: Travis
lines: Oh no!

speaker: Justin
lines: I knew it!

speaker: Griffin
lines: On the other end of this airlock, it— actually, I know I said there was a hatch, a hatch, on the other side. There’s actually two hatches. It, uh, it branches off, forming sort of a Y junction. Um, and hanging in between those two hatches is, a, uh, a sign, and it is noting which is in either direction. And you hear Lucas say

speaker: Lucas
lines: Now you should be at a— a— a branch in the path, um, and—  and I’ll be able to buy us a little bit more time. We’re at about— oh, we’re running real low, guys. We’re at about ten minutes before this thing h-hits the water, um, so whichever one you go in, I’ll be able to disable the airlock on the other side and-and buy us a bit more time by giving me more energy to channel, uh, into the core. Um, so— so pick a side, and I’ll just, uh, I’ll— after you go through, I’ll shut down the other one.

speaker: Travis
lines: What are the two sides?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Well, to the left, you see a sign over the hatch that says, “Research Materials Storage Chamber,” and then, on the right, you see a sign that says, “The Magical World of Elevators.”

speaker: Travis
lines: Really?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin—

speaker: Griffin
lines: That’s what it says.

speaker: Justin
lines: Griffin’s really sticking it to the people who say he’s not allowed to have elevators in this game.

speaker: Travis
lines: Um—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Again, it’s the Research Materials Storage Chamber, or the Magical World of Elevators.

speaker: Taako
lines: This one’s easy. It’s elevators. Let’s go.

speaker: Merle
lines: Here we go!

speaker: Griffin
lines: Uh, okay. You walk forward and open up this next hatch, and it spins open to… a beautiful, ornate room. Um, a fairly large chamber that almost sort of resembles, like, a museum with these different exhibits lining both sides of this long chamber. And inside of each exhibit, in little brass and wood display cases, you see different elevators. Um, and you hear Lucas chime in and say, like

speaker: Lucas
lines: Oh, you made it to The Magical World of Elevators, huh?

speaker: Magnus, Merle, & Taako
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Lucas
lines: It’s, uh— well, this lab has been in my family for a few generations. I— I inherited it from my— from my mom, um, but there was a codicil in the will that required that I keep this museum, uh, honoring my grandpa’s greatest technological accomplishment, intact. He— he invented the elevator. And honestly, like, most of the technological, uh, advancements in our world. That was all— that was all Grandpa Roman. So, um, yeah, I couldn’t change it, but go ahead and have a look around. It’s— I think you might learn a little bit of something about elevators.

speaker: Magnus
lines: Don’t we have, like, shit to do?

speaker: Taako
lines: Is it hard feeling like you’re always in his shadow? Does it—

speaker: Magnus
lines: Ooh, good question.

speaker: Taako
lines: Do you feel like you’re in Roman’s shadow?

speaker: Lucas
lines: I mean, a little bit, sometimes, like—

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Lucas
lines: I’m trying to make my own mark on the world, and frankly, I feel like a lot of his inventions were kind of primitive, and people just aren’t as excited about inventions. Like, when the first elevator came out, forget about it. But you try and invent a new, better elevator, and people don’t wanna hear any of it.

speaker: Merle
lines: Well, it’s an up and down business.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Oh my god.

speaker: Taako
lines: People say that about, um, Thomas Edison a lot. Like, he invented the lightbulb, but— right?— but, like, they didn’t have them back then, right? So if I had been around back then, that would have been easy for me, ‘cause they didn’t have light bulbs. They didn’t have anything. So, like, inventing stuff was way easier. These days, I’d have to invent, like, a double light bulb or something to even get that kind of impact.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Holy— just— wait— pau— hold on for a second. I gotta write that down.

speaker: Taako
lines: Double light bulb.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Double…

speaker: Taako
lines: You can have that one, that’s fine.

speaker: Lucas
lines: Light bulb…

speaker: Merle
lines: No, don’t give it to him!

speaker: Taako
lines: Oh, money's no object to me.

speaker: Merle
lines: [groans]

speaker: Griffin
lines: That is patently untrue. That’s not in character. I’m just telling you that’s— I’m calling horseshit on that on behalf of our listening audience.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, no, no, no, no—

speaker: Clint
lines: It’s just a façade.

speaker: Justin
lines: No, no, no, the fact that money is patently important to Taako is patently untrue. That Taako would say that—

speaker: Griffin
lines: Yeah.

speaker: Justin
lines: —is not.

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay, fair.

speaker: Clint
lines: And I think we learned a little bit about Lucas today.

speaker: Taako
lines: Yeah, I feel like we’ve really grown.

speaker: Magnus
lines: I think we’ve all— let’s go home and think about what we’ve learned.

speaker: Griffin
lines: I gotta say, the timing on this episode’s a little bit off, ‘cause I think we’re at the end of it now, and, man, it would’ve been cool if it had ended with Della Reese stabbing a crystal monster to death and not the three of you entering a museum and then, like, having a talk with some guy about his grandpa.

speaker: Travis
lines: Well, why don’t— why don’t you re-cut that in here, Griffin?

speaker: Griffin
lines: Okay. Della Reese shows up and stabs through an elevator. She says,

speaker: Della Reese
lines: Well, I got a taste for it now.

speaker: Travis
lines: “I just love killing.”

speaker: Justin
lines: And hates elevators.

speaker: Travis
lines: “Hi, I’m Della Reese and I love killing.”

speaker: Griffin
lines: Looks like this elevator just got touched by an angel, right, guys?

speaker: Travis
lines: More like a Della-vator.

speaker: Justin
lines: This one’s going down!
